cta.note: Initial visit: $120 (90 minutes including consultation and treatment)
cta.title: Ready to Get Started?
cta.description: Schedule your initial consultation and take the first step toward natural wellness

items.answer: Most people feel little to no pain. The needles are hair-thin (much finer than injection needles), and insertion feels like a tiny pinch or mosquito bite, if anything. Once needles are in place, most patients feel deeply relaxed. Many fall asleep during treatment!
items.question: Will acupuncture hurt?

items.answer: This varies by condition. Acute issues may improve in 3-6 sessions, while chronic conditions typically require 10-15 treatments or more. We'll create a personalized treatment plan during your first visit and adjust based on your progress.
items.question: How many treatments will I need?

items.answer: Yes! You're welcome to bring a friend or family member. They can wait in our reception area or, with your permission, join you during the consultation portion of your visit. For privacy and optimal relaxation, they typically can't stay during treatment.
items.question: Can I bring someone with me?

items.answer: Many people who are nervous about needles are pleasantly surprised by acupuncture. The needles are extremely thin and insertion is usually painless. We'll go at your pace, explain everything, and can start with fewer needles if you prefer. We also offer non-needle modalities like herbal medicine, cupping, and massage.
items.question: What if I'm afraid of needles?

items.answer: Yes, absolutely continue all prescribed medications unless your prescribing doctor tells you otherwise. Acupuncture complements conventional medicine and doesn't require you to stop medications. Never discontinue prescription medications without consulting your doctor.
items.question: Should I continue my medications?

items.answer: Rest! Avoid strenuous activity for a few hours after treatment. Drink plenty of water. You may feel deeply relaxed, energized, or sleepyâ€”all normal responses. Avoid alcohol for 24 hours after treatment to give your body the best chance to heal.
items.question: What should I do after treatment?

items.answer: Light exercise is fine, but avoid intense workouts right before treatment as they can affect pulse diagnosis and how your body responds to acupuncture. Save vigorous exercise for the day after treatment.
items.question: Can I exercise before my appointment?

items.answer: Please give us at least 24 hours notice. Late cancellations (less than 24 hours) or no-shows are charged 50% of the treatment fee. We understand emergencies happen and will work with you in those situations.
items.question: What if I need to cancel or reschedule?

hero.title: Bienvenido, nuevo cliente
hero.subtitle: Todo lo necesario antes de tu primer pedido con WeWash

insurance.text: We accept most major insurance plans that include acupuncture benefits. Call us at (845) 381-1106 to verify your coverage before your visit. We can also provide detailed receipts (superbills) for out-of-network reimbursement.
insurance.title: Insurance & Payment

pricing.description: Initial visit includes 90-minute consultation + treatment. Follow-up visits are typically 60 minutes.

tips.title: Eat Beforehand
tips.description: Have a light meal or snack 1-2 hours before your appointment. Don't come on an empty stomach, as acupuncture can lower blood sugar.

tips.title: Wear Comfortable Clothing
tips.description: Wear loose, comfortable clothing that can easily be rolled up to access your arms, legs, and back. We have gowns available if needed.

tips.title: Avoid Caffeine & Alcohol
tips.description: Minimize caffeine on treatment days and avoid alcohol completely. Both can interfere with pulse diagnosis and treatment effectiveness.

tips.title: Stay Hydrated
tips.description: Drink plenty of water before and after treatment to support your body's natural healing processes.

tips.title: Allow Time After
tips.description: Don't rush. Allow 15-30 minutes after treatment before returning to stressful activities. You may feel deeply relaxed.

tips.title: Avoid Strong Scents
tips.description: Please don't wear perfume or heavily scented products, as some patients may be sensitive.

preparation.title: How to Prepare
preparation.subtitle: Follow these guidelines to get the most from your visit

items.description: We'll verify your benefits and handle billing
Include prescription meds, supplements, and herbs
We accept cash, cards, HSA/FSA, check
Download from our website or arrive 15 minutes early
Write them down so you don't forget

introduction.text: Nos alegra recibirte en WeWash. Esta guia te ayuda a preparar tu primer pedido residencial o comercial.
introduction.highlight: Los primeros pedidos salen mas rapido cuando completas tipo de servicio, ZIP y direccion.

whatToExpect.note: Please arrive 10-15 minutes early if you haven't completed intake forms in advance

steps.title: Intake & Health History
steps.description: We'll review your completed intake forms and discuss your health history, current symptoms, medications, and wellness goals. This is your opportunity to share everything relevant to your health.

steps.title: TCM Examination
details: Palpation of affected areas if relevant
steps.description: Traditional Chinese Medicine uses unique diagnostic methods that give us insights Western medicine doesn't capture. These are completely non-invasive and painless.

steps.title: Diagnosis & Treatment Plan
details: Explanation of your TCM diagnosis in understandable terms
How your symptoms relate to TCM patterns
steps.description: Based on the consultation and examination, we'll explain your TCM diagnosis, what's causing your symptoms, and create a personalized treatment plan.

steps.title: First Acupuncture Treatment
details: Comfortable positioning on heated treatment table
Additional modalities if beneficial (cupping, moxa, etc.)
Many patients fall asleep during treatment
steps.description: You'll receive your first acupuncture treatment during this initial visit. Most people find it much more comfortable than they expected!

whatToExpect.title: What to Expect at Your First Visit
whatToExpect.subtitle: Your initial appointment follows a thorough, systematic approach
